title: Gerald McQuade
text:
PhD candidate in economics at Lancaster University Management School. My advisors are Catherine Porter and Saurabh Singhal.
My research interests are in early childhood development and skill formation, the socio-economic impacts of climate and environmental shocks, and the interaction between these two processes in low and middle income contexts.
I am currently a visiting student with Young Lives at the University of Oxford, hosted by Marta Favara. In winter 2023 I will be a visiting researcher with Grupo De Análisis para el Desarrollo, in Lima, Peru.
you can view my full CV here.
Proudly .

title: Research

Think of the children: Inter-generational effects of drought exposure on offspring outcomes
